12.4 Infective Exacerbation of Bronchiectasis 
Type of 
Infection 
First Line (with Dosage 
and Duration) 
Alternative (with 
dosage and Duration) 
Comments 
OPD 
Tab Amoxicillin-
clavulanate 1g BD for 5-
7 days  
 
Tab Cefuroxime 500 
mg BD for 5-7 days 
Symptoms of infective 
exacerbation include fever and 
sputum purulence. 
 
Sputum culture is 
recommended for targeted 
therapy. 
Duration may be prolonged to 
14 days if very slow 
improvement in symptoms. 
 
Avoid empiric use of 
fluoroquinolones. Use only as 
targeted therapy (after culture 
result) and after ruling out TB. 
IPD 
Inj Piperacillin- 
tazobactam 4.5g IV q6h 
for 5-7 days 
Or 
Inj Cefoperazone – 
sulbactam 3g IV BD for 
5-7 days 
Inj Meropenem 1g 
TDS  
Or 
Inj Imipenem- 
cilastatin 500mg q6h  
for 5-7 days 
For common etiological agents associated with Infective exacerbation of bronchiectasis, see 
Annexure B.12.4 
Reference: 
1. Polverino E, Goeminne PC, McDonnell MJ, et al. European Respiratory Society guidelines for 
the management of adult bronchiectasis. Eur Respir J 2017; 50: 1700629 [https://doi.org/ 
10.1183/13993003.00629-2017].
